intro: Romulea tortilis, commonly known as the spiral squill, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, spirally arranged leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Its bulbs store water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Romulea tortilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
